meanings.definition: To gradually lose brightness or vividness.
meanings.sent1: The colors on the old painting began to fade over time.
meanings.sent2: The memories of that summer vacation slowly fade away.
meanings.sent3: As the sun set, the vibrant hues of the sky started to fade into darkness.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm for the project started to fade like a distant memory.
meanings.sent5: The once bright stars fade into the night sky, one by one.

meanings.definition: To gradually disappear or become less noticeable.
meanings.sent1: The footprints in the sand will fade with the incoming tide.
meanings.sent2: His voice started to fade as he walked further away.
meanings.sent3: The scent of fresh flowers began to fade, leaving only a faint trace in the air.
meanings.sent4: The music from the party slowly faded into the background noise of the city.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight fades behind the mountains, signaling the end of the day.

meanings.sent1: With each passing day, his energy seemed to fade a little more.
meanings.sent2: The flame in the fireplace started to fade as the wood burned out.
meanings.sent3: Her determination began to fade as the challenges piled up.
meanings.sent4: The cheers from the crowd faded as the team lost the game.
meanings.sent5: The flowers in the garden fade without proper care and attention.

meanings.definition: A gradual change in color or shade.
meanings.sent1: The artist used a fade from light blue to dark blue in the background.
meanings.sent2: The fade from green to yellow in the leaves was beautifully done.
meanings.sent3: The fade from pink to purple in the sunset created a stunning sky.
meanings.sent4: The fade from red to orange in the autumn leaves was breathtaking.
meanings.sent5: The gradual fade from white to gray in the clouds was mesmerizing.
